modules.description: Converts between string representations and a logging level type, supporting case-insensitive parsing and consistent output formatting. Works with an abstract type representing log severity levels. Used to parse command line arguments into valid logging levels and to generate human-readable log level names.

Encapsulates logging level conversion and formatting, enabling seamless interaction between string inputs and an abstract severity type. Provides functions to parse and serialize log levels, supporting case-insensitive input and standardized output. Allows for dynamic configuration based on user input, such as setting the log level from a command line argument. Facilitates consistent logging across applications by ensuring uniform representation of severity levels.

Converts Ptime values to human-readable strings with optional time zone adjustment, and adjusts time zone offsets according to RFC 3339 formatting rules. Works with Ptime.t and Ptime.tz_offset_s types. Used to generate standardized time strings for logging and to normalize time zone offsets in network protocols.
Logs messages with severity levels, timestamps, and customizable output formats. Works with strings, integers, and custom log levels. Used to track application flow and debug issues in real-time.

Converts and formats log levels and timestamps, enabling consistent and configurable logging. Handles severity levels as an abstract type, supporting case-insensitive parsing and serialization, and manages Ptime values with RFC 3339-compliant time zone adjustments. Users can set log levels dynamically and generate standardized time strings for logs. Examples include parsing "INFO" to a severity value and converting a UTC timestamp to a localized string.
